Hepatitis C virus (HCV) is a major cause of chronic liver disease, cirrhosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma, giving rise to a major public health issue on a global scale
1 . It is a highly genetically diverse single-stranded positive-sense RNA virus in the Flaviviridae family
2 . The prevalence of Hepatitis C virus globally has been estimated to be approximately 180 million infections. HCV is phylogenetically classified into 7 major genotypes (clades) and 57 subtypes (subclades)
3 . Geographic origin and transmission risk category influence the global distribution of HCV genotypes and subtypes
